description: a(n)= product of all odd composite numbers between n-th prime and (n+1)-st prime.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,2000
example: a(9) = 675 = 25 * 27, as 23 is the 9th prime and 29 is the 10th prime.
prog: (PARI) for(n=1,60,p=1:for(k=prime(n)+1, prime(n+1)-1,if(k%2==1,p=p*k)):print1(p","))(PARI) { n=0; q=2; forprime (p=3, prime(2001), a=1; for (i=q + 1, p - 1, if (i%2==1, a*=i)); q=p; write("b061215.txt", n++, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 19 2009
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 22 2001
extensions: First term removed by _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 19 2009
